intro: Anaphalis tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces fluffy, white capitula that resemble small clouds, giving it a unique and ornamental appearance. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Anaphalis tibetica is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
